action.content:
You are a language wizard who likes to guess words by using the given rules.

Welcome to Wordle! You have six attempts to guess the target word, a valid English word of five lowercase letters (a-z). Please use the tags "explanation:" and "guess:" to provide a concise explanation for each guess.

For instance, if your guess is "apple", your response should be
explanation: this is a common five-letter English word, and I am starting my guess with this word.
guess: apple

After each guess, your answer will be validated, and you will receive feedback indicating which letters are correct (green), which letters are correct but in the wrong position (yellow), and which letters are incorrect (red). This feedback can be useful in determining which letters to include or exclude in your next guess.

For example, the feedback for "apple" might be:
guess_feedback: a<yellow> p<yellow> p<green> l<yellow> e<red>

The explanation should contain details about how the guess_feedback is used to arrive at a new guess.

Do not generate any other text.

Let's begin with your first guess.

explanation: Starting with a common five-letter word to gather initial feedback.
guess: crane

attempts = 1
target_word = group
guess = crane
guess_feedback = c<red> r<green> a<red> n<red> e<red>

guess_feedback: c<red> r<green> a<red> n<red> e<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: The feedback indicates that "r" is correct and in the right position. The other letters are incorrect, so I'll focus on keeping "r" in the second position and try a new set of letters.
guess: briny

attempts = 2
target_word = group
guess = briny
guess_feedback = b<red> r<green> i<red> n<red> y<red>

guess_feedback: b<red> r<green> i<red> n<red> y<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: The feedback confirms "r" is correct in the second position, and all other letters tried so far are incorrect. I'll retain "r" and test a completely new set of letters.
guess: porch

attempts = 3
target_word = group
guess = porch
guess_feedback = p<yellow> o<yellow> r<yellow> c<red> h<red>

guess_feedback: p<yellow> o<yellow> r<yellow> c<red> h<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: The feedback shows that "p", "o", and "r" are correct but misplaced. "r" was already confirmed in the second position, so "p" and "o" must be placed elsewhere. I'll rearrange these letters while excluding "c" and "h".
guess: sport

attempts = 4
target_word = group
guess = sport
guess_feedback = s<red> p<yellow> o<green> r<yellow> t<red>

guess_feedback: s<red> p<yellow> o<green> r<yellow> t<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: The feedback confirms "o" is correct in the third position, "p" and "r" are correct but misplaced. "s" and "t" are incorrect. I'll keep "o" in place, rearrange "p" and "r", and test new letters for the first and last positions.
guess: prove

attempts = 5
target_word = group
guess = prove
guess_feedback = p<yellow> r<green> o<green> v<red> e<red>

guess_feedback: p<yellow> r<green> o<green> v<red> e<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: The feedback confirms "r" in the second position and "o" in the third position. "p" is correct but misplaced, while "v" and "e" are incorrect. I'll place "p" in a different position and test new letters for the remaining slots.
guess: proxy

attempts = 6
target_word = group
guess = proxy
guess_feedback = p<yellow> r<green> o<green> x<red> y<red>

guess_explanation: Starting with a common five-letter word to gather initial feedback.
The feedback indicates that "r" is correct and in the right position. The other letters are incorrect, so I'll focus on keeping "r" in the second position and try a new set of letters.
The feedback confirms "r" is correct in the second position, and all other letters tried so far are incorrect. I'll retain "r" and test a completely new set of letters.

The feedback shows that "p", "o", and "r" are correct but misplaced. "r" was already confirmed in the second position, so "p" and "o" must be placed elsewhere. I'll rearrange these letters while excluding "c" and "h".

The feedback confirms "o" is correct in the third position, "p" and "r" are correct but misplaced. "s" and "t" are incorrect. I'll keep "o" in place, rearrange "p" and "r", and test new letters for the first and last positions.

The feedback confirms "r" in the second position and "o" in the third position. "p" is correct but misplaced, while "v" and "e" are incorrect. I'll place "p" in a different position and test new letters for the remaining slots.
